comments.body:
this is essentially a `NullProvider`, what is the plan for `vsphere` provider after this change?
otherwise, you could use either `local` or `skeleton` provider in your configure (both are same as `NullProvider`).

i noticed a similar change from openstack, https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/74370, if this is something we are trying to achieve, i am good with the change (to support vsphere provider on some e2e storage tests).

cc @BenTheElder

`skeleton` should be the preferred null provider going forward üëç 
we did allow openstack in due to the storage tests though. cc @dims

This change is indeed to support e2e vsphere storage tests.
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/test/e2e/storage/vsphere

Multiple tests in this folder are configured to skip the test if the provider specified isn't vsphere.
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/storage/vsphere/vsphere_zone_support.go

`	BeforeEach(func() {
		framework.SkipUnlessProviderIs("vsphere")
		Bootstrap(f)`
